===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/yaukan/}} → {{IPAchar|/yɔːkan/}} → {{IPAchar|/yoːkan/}}

Originally from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ようかん}} compound {{m|zh|羊羹|tr=yang kæng|lit=sheep + soup, broth}}.  The {{m|en|gelatin}} meaning arose from the way that sheep meat or other parts would be boiled down to produce [[gelatin]].

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|ようかん|y=o|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ようかん|hhira=やうかん}}

# a [[gelatin]] made from boiled sheep and used in [[soup]]s
# [[yokan]], a thick jellied [[dessert]] made of [[adzuki]] (red bean paste), [[agar]], and [[sugar]]
#* {{RQ:Nippo Jisho|823}}
#*: '''Yôcan'''. ヤゥカン (羊羹) 豆に粗糖をまぜて,こねたもので作った食物.
